newsitem.title: USA: Computer Associates profit rises 27 percent.
newsitem.headline: Computer Associates profit rises 27 percent.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc. said Tuesday its fiscal fourth-quarter net income rose a better-than-expected 27 percent on strong sales of its computer network management software.

The third-largest independent software company said profit for the quarter ended March 31 rose to $336 million, or 90 cents a share, from $265.1 million, or 70 cents, in the same quarter a year ago. Fourth-quarter revenue rose 9 percent to $1.21 billion from $1.11 billion.

Computer Associates, based in Islandia, New York, had told investors a month ago that it expected to report earnings per-share of about 90 cents for the fourth quarter. Before the forecast, Wall Street expected the company to earn 86 cents.

Computer Associates writes software that manages the operations of mainframe computers and giant corporate computer networks. The company said strong sales of its CA-Unicenter network management product accounted for much of the quarter's growth.
Sales of networking products rose 48 percent to $1.36 billion for the fiscal year, the company said.

For the year, profit from operations rose 27 percent to $1.53 billion, or $2.54 a share, from $1.2 billion, or $1.99 a share, a year ago. With a $598 million charge for an acquisition, Computer Associates' net income for the most recent year was $932.3 million, or 97 cents a share.
Revenue for the year rose 15 percent to $4.04 billion from $3.5 billion the year before.
